replies.body:
I'd say it has something to do with your long history of being punished by instant feedback. Not including this ban, you have 7 past cases of bans due to negative behaviour and one due to intentional feeding. This is the most I've ever seen through instant feedback as permabans are usually handed out much faster.

By the time this game was played, your standing with the system was extremely poor, so it wouldn't have taken much to push you over to permaban status. You're lucky you weren't permabanned prior to this is what I'm saying.

In this game your whole team was really positive, you were the one player being unsportsmanlike to your own team as well as the enemy. Enough people decided your behaviour was report worthy and the instant feedback system decided that enough was enough, and handed the permanent suspension.

Hi Gehrin, I'm a bit of a lurker on the boards, don't say much unless something sparks me, and this guy did. 

I ended up contacting PheroxNZ about this, before you answered, to get more info and he swore he doesn't remember being banned 7 times. He recalls a 24hr ban in Season 1 for Int feeding and has a few Low Prio Queues since after being flagged by Leavebuster, but nothing major like the 7 time bans you are talking about. No Chat Restrictions, no Time Bans ...he doesn't even recall getting warning pop-ups in-client.

Can you shed some light on this for him please?

He's pretty upset atm like he's just had a Bad Breakup out of the blue and for no reason he can understand and Riot is the Shitty Girlfriend who dumped him and broke his heart lol but I think if he had more of an idea of a timeline over which this incidents happened he might accept his punishment and understand it was deserved which will help with any future levels of toxicity. ATM he's just really angry and upset - Bad Breakup remember </3 - and the only thing he's currently feeling is 'Riot banned me for no reason' because he is confused over these 7 bans so he's not in any position to have a rational conversation.

I spent some time to dig further. It appears that your account has been shared for a long time, with a friend that you've played with regularly who has two banned accounts of their own. This person is responsible for at least a few of your bans and is why your account has used up its **many** chances to reform. The fact that two people have been playing ranked on this account even amounts to boosting. This is the risk you take when you share your account and one of the reasons we **expressly forbid account sharing**.

We don't require you to pay money to unban your account. We require you to not take the actions that would get it banned in the first place.
Plus i wasnt banned for boosting i was banned for this chat log

> [{quoted}](name=PheroxNZ,realm=OCE,application-id=T8eq2lFQ,discussion-id=be63rQGe,comment-id=0002000000000002,timestamp=2016-10-19T05:17:46.524+0000)
>
> Plus i wasnt banned for boosting i was banned for this chat log

Not the point Gehrin was getting at. The point was that your were sharing your account, which is explicitly against the rules (as stated in the TOU and EULA), and, since it included ranked games, it would fall under the category of "boosting" which, again, is explicitly against the rules. That's not even considering that the other person using your account had *multiple* accounts that were perma-banned previously.

Point being: you're not just in the sh!t for your negative attitude anymore and there's no way you are *ever* going to regain access to that account.
Ok, so unban me for being toxic and ban me for boosting then, dont call me "extremely toxic" for this bullshit lol.
This is so wrong. He deserves a refund for the money spent on the account.

No, he doesn't. He broke the rules he agreed to in the TOU and EULA, not to mention the fact that all "assets" (champions, skins, runes etc) associated with an account (technically) have *no monetary value whatsoever*, which is also stated in the TOU and EULA. Then you consider the fact that Riot reserves the right to refuse refunds (within the bound of applicable law) at their own discretion (Also stated in the TOU and EULA). Pherox forfeited any *potential* right to a refund when he broke his agreements with Riot (key work there being "potential").
